LineNo: 13284474,

Narrator: The Porte Drazon Observatory Tower...
en


The Porte Drazon Observatory Tower stood tall against the night sky, stars twinkling overhead, as my motorcade arrived beneath it.

LineNo: 13284576,

Narrator: Before long, Titus and I vacated ou...
en


Before long, Titus and I vacated our vehicle, went inside, and began ascending the spiraling staircase.

LineNo: 13284678,

Narrator: The celestial event held the prospe...
en


The celestial event held the prospect of a connection to the divine, a moment I had been anticipating with interest.

LineNo: 13285154,

Narrator: We eventually reached the top. I wa...
en


We eventually reached the top. I was nearly out of breath, whereas Titus seemed to breeze through it without breaking a sweat.

LineNo: 13285256,

Narrator: By the time I was halfway up, I was...
en


By the time I was halfway up, I was beginning to regret that an elevator hadn't been installed.

LineNo: 13285636,

Narrator: Titus, on the other hand, barely br...
en


Titus, on the other hand, barely broke a sweat.

LineNo: 13285850,

Player_Romus: I really need to get on whatever w...
en


"I really need to get on whatever workout regiment you're on."

LineNo: 13285952,

Player_Romus: At least pretend like you're not s...
en


"At least pretend like you're not struggling to climb so many stairs."

LineNo: 13286054,

Player_Romus: Slow down, will you? You're making...
en


"Slow down, will you? You're making me look bad."

LineNo: 13286156,

Titus Gordion: It would be my honor. Just let me...
en


"It would be my honor. Just let me know when, and I'll make it happen."

LineNo: 13286258,

Narrator: Titus smiled -- the closest I think...
en


Titus smiled -- the closest I think I've ever seen him to laughing.

LineNo: 13286360,

Titus Gordion: I call it my 'graceful ascent' tec...
en


"I call it my 'graceful ascent' technique. It's a Golden Guard secret."

LineNo: 13286462,

Titus Gordion: My apologies, sir.  I shall adjust...
en


"My apologies, sir.  I shall adjust my stride to align more harmoniously with your esteemed pace."

LineNo: 13286580,

Narrator: We were met by two guards standing...
en


We were met by two guards standing alongside a wooden door, one of whom opened it for us. I stepped inside while Titus remained behind.

LineNo: 13286682,

Narrator: The room, a sanctuary of ancient kn...
en


The room, a sanctuary of ancient knowledge was dimly lit. The air carried the scent of aged books and burning incense. Candles cast a soft glow around the room.

LineNo: 13286784,

Narrator: Sal, who was hunched over an altar...
en


Sal, who was hunched over an altar adorned with celestial charts and religious artifacts, appeared deeply engrossed in preparations for the celestial event, seemingly unaware of my presence.

LineNo: 13286886,

Player_Romus: Sal, my trusted advisor, I have be...
en


"Sal, my trusted advisor, I have been looking forward to this visit."

LineNo: 13286988,

Player_Romus: Sal, my trusted spiritual advisor,...
en


"Sal, my trusted spiritual advisor, I've been looking forward to this visit."

LineNo: 13287090,

Player_Romus: I see my arrival has gone unnotice...
en


"I see my arrival has gone unnoticed amidst your celestial preparations."

LineNo: 13287192,

Player_Romus: Most people know to stand when the...
en


"Most people know to stand when their king enters the room."

LineNo: 13287294,

Player_Romus: I hope I'm not interrupting anythi...
en


"I hope I'm not interrupting anything."

LineNo: 13288230,

Player_Romus: I guess my regal presence doesn't...
en


"I guess my regal presence doesn't register on your celestial frequency."

LineNo: 13288332,

Sal Ignacius: Forgive my oversight, Your Majesty...
en


"Forgive my oversight, Your Majesty. I didn't realize you had entered. I've been immersed in arrangements for tonight's momentous occasion."

LineNo: 13288458,

Narrator: He looked up as if startled.
en


He looked up as if startled.

LineNo: 13288560,

Sal Ignacius: It's quite remarkable that we're a...
en


"It's quite remarkable that we're about to witness the same celestial alignment St. Wruhec beheld so many years ago. You're acquainted with the story, aren't you?"

LineNo: 13288686,

Sal Ignacius: The cosmos has a language of its o...
en


"The cosmos has a language of its own. Tonight, it speaks of destiny and the intertwining of fates."

LineNo: 13288804,

Player_Romus: One I look forward to hearing for...
en


"One I look forward to hearing for myself. Speaking of which, how do the people of Rizia interpret the cosmic language?"

LineNo: 13288906,

Player_Romus: Intriguing. Please, go on.
en


"Intriguing. Please, go on."

LineNo: 13289564,

Player_Romus: Well, I didn't bring my 'Interstel...
en


"Well, I didn't bring my 'Interstellar Linguist' with me, so you'll have to do the translating for me."

LineNo: 13289666,

Player_Romus: And I do hope its message illumina...
en


"And I do hope its message illuminates our religious journey. Speaking of which, how do the people of Rizia interpret the cosmic language?"

LineNo: 13289768,

Player_Romus: Destiny is what I decree.
en


"Destiny is what I decree."

LineNo: 13289870,

Player_Romus: Until then, let's pass the time by...
en


"Until then, let's pass the time by speaking about the state of religious affairs in Rizia."

LineNo: 13290250,

Sal Ignacius: Unfortunately, many -- particularl...
en


"Unfortunately, many -- particularly in our religious community -- wouldn't agree."

LineNo: 13290368,

Sal Ignacius: Certainly. I'd be delighted to pro...
en


"Certainly. I'd be delighted to provide you with an overview of the prevailing sentiments within our religious communities."

LineNo: 13290470,

Sal Ignacius: It holds a unique place in their h...
en


"It holds a unique place in their hearts and is as diverse as the stars above. As for their overall prevailing sentiments..."

LineNo: 13290572,

Sal Ignacius: It occupies a distinctive corner i...
en


"It occupies a distinctive corner in their hearts, as diverse as the stars that grace the night sky. As for their overall prevailing sentiments..."

LineNo: 13290674,

Sal Ignacius: I hope to do more than just transl...
en


"I hope to do more than just translate, but decipher the cosmic narrative, as embodied by your loyal subject below."

LineNo: 13290776,

Narrator: Sal's eyes lit up, illuminated by f...
en


Sal's eyes lit up, illuminated by faint moonlight.

LineNo: 13290878,

Sal Ignacius: Fellow Wruhecists overwhelmingly f...
en


"Fellow Wruhecists overwhelmingly favor your reign."

LineNo: 13291258,

Sal Ignacius: The restoration of the Archsanctua...
en


"The restoration of the Archsanctuary of Plavo has helped solidify their support."

LineNo: 13291638,

Sal Ignacius: As were the state's welfare progra...
en


"As were the state's welfare programs."

LineNo: 13292034,

Player_Romus: Our people thrive when their faith...
en


"Our people thrive when their faith is strong. And the Dastnurists?"

LineNo: 13292414,

Player_Romus: Our society flourishes when indivi...
en


"Our society flourishes when individuals have a strong sense of purpose and conviction. How about the followers of Dastnurism?"

LineNo: 13292516,

Player_Romus: As to be expected. What of the Das...
en


"As to be expected. What of the Dastnurists?"

LineNo: 13292618,

Player_Romus: That pleases me to hear. What of t...
en


"That pleases me to hear. What of the Dastnurist community?"

LineNo: 13292998,

Sal Ignacius: As a community made up primarily o...
en


"As a community made up primarily of Wehzek and Rumburgians, your tolerance for diversity has earned respect among them."

LineNo: 13293100,

Player_Romus: Good. The last thing we need is a...
en


"Good. The last thing we need is a Wruhecist revolt on our hands. What about the Dastnurists in our realm?"

LineNo: 13293202,

Sal Ignacius: Building the Dastnurist Grand Sanc...
en


"Building the Dastnurist Grand Sanctuary of Sallabes has been especially instrumental in enhancing Your Majesty's likability within their community."

LineNo: 13293582,

Sal Ignacius: Overall, they appreciate the prese...
en


"Overall, they appreciate the preservation of their well-being as a minority religion."

LineNo: 13293700,

Sal Ignacius: They see it not only as a physical...
en


"They see it not only as a physical expansion but also as a symbolic representation of the growth and preservation of their religious heritage within our kingdom."

LineNo: 13293802,

Player_Romus: It warms my heart to know the Arch...
en


"It warms my heart to know the Archsanctuary's growth is perceived positively. It's a reminder that, beyond politics, we nurture a kingdom where all faiths find a place. Now, what of the Golcondists?"

LineNo: 13293904,

Player_Romus: I'm heartened to see the positive...
en


"I'm heartened to see the positive reception of the Archsanctuary's growth. It underscores our commitment to inclusivity beyond political considerations. Now, what about the Golcondists?"

LineNo: 13294006,

Player_Romus: The Archsanctuary serves its purpo...
en


"The Archsanctuary serves its purpose. Their appreciation is merely a byproduct of my strategic moves to align them with my vision for a stable kingdom. It's about control, Sal."

LineNo: 13294664,

Sal Ignacius: It goes without saying that the bl...
en


"It goes without saying that the blasphemy law continues to strain relations."

LineNo: 13295044,

Sal Ignacius: It would have surely added to thei...
en


"It would have surely added to their list of grievances had it been implemented."

LineNo: 13295440,

Player_Romus: It's a challenge to navigate the r...
en


"It's a challenge to navigate the religious landscape, Sal. I want unity, but not at the cost of freedom."

LineNo: 13295542,

Player_Romus: Fingers crossed that we've hit the...
en


"Fingers crossed that we've hit the stability sweet spot and it doesn't nosedive."

LineNo: 13295644,

Player_Romus: Oh, good. I'd hate to think they'd...
en


"Oh, good. I'd hate to think they'd consider putting me on their exclusive 'List of Grievances.'"

LineNo: 13295746,

Player_Romus: Navigating the diverse religious t...
en


"Navigating the diverse religious terrain, Sal, is quite a challenge. My goal is to foster unity without compromising individual freedom."

LineNo: 13295848,

Player_Romus: The idea of Rizians and Palesians...
en


"The idea of Rizians and Palesians taking arms against each other gnaws at my soul. I wonder, does Wruhecism permit such conflict? Is it justified?"

LineNo: 13295950,

Sal Ignacius: Your Majesty, the teachings of Wru...
en


"Your Majesty, the teachings of Wruhism advocate for peace, unity, and the pursuit of harmony."

LineNo: 13296052,

Sal Ignacius: War contradicts these principles,...
en


"War contradicts these principles, causing suffering and discord."

LineNo: 13296154,

Sal Ignacius: However, in the sacred texts, we f...
en


"However, in the sacred texts, we find instances where war was deemed just, a means to protect the divine order."

LineNo: 13296272,

Player_Romus: In that case, regale me with tales...
en


"In that case, regale me with tales of war and divine justification. But infuse a bit of humor for good measure."

LineNo: 13296374,

Player_Romus: Does Wruhecism condemn taking back...
en


"Does Wruhecism condemn taking back what's rightfully ours by force? Or is it merely a convenient shroud for the weak?"

LineNo: 13296476,

Player_Romus: In the midst of this war, I find m...
en


"In the midst of this war, I find myself yearning for a swift end to the conflict. Can Wruhecism provide insights or principles that align with my hope for a peaceful resolution?"

LineNo: 13296856,

Player_Romus: And how do we know if going to war...
en


"And how do we know if going to war with Pales aligns with the text in which you speak?"

LineNo: 13296958,

Player_Romus: Justified? That wasn't what I was...
en


"Justified? That wasn't what I was expecting to hear. Please continue."

LineNo: 13297616,

Player_Romus: So, in the cosmic manual, there's...
en


"So, in the cosmic manual, there's a chapter on 'Justifiable Warfare.' Good bedtime reading, I'm sure."

LineNo: 13297718,

Player_Romus: And how do we know if going to war...
en


"And how do we know if going to war with Pales aligns with the divine order?"

LineNo: 13297820,

Player_Romus: Peace is for those content with me...
en


"Peace is for those content with mediocrity. A king must be strong, commanding, willing to seize what's rightfully his. What use is a faith that shackles ambition?"

LineNo: 13297922,

Player_Romus: I respect the pursuit of peace, bu...
en


"I respect the pursuit of peace, but I'm curious about how strength and ambition can coexist within our faith."

LineNo: 13298302,

Sal Ignacius: It's a delicate balance. The scrip...
en


"It's a delicate balance. The scriptures speak of just wars, wars waged in defense of the divine message or to safeguard the pillars of enlightenment."

LineNo: 13298404,

Sal Ignacius: Yet, we must scrutinize our motive...
en


"Yet, we must scrutinize our motives."

LineNo: 13298506,

Sal Ignacius: Is our cause just, or are we swaye...
en


"Is our cause just, or are we swayed by ambition?"

LineNo: 13298624,

Player_Romus: I aim to protect our kingdom, Sal....
en


"I aim to protect our kingdom, Sal. To ensure the pillars of our society thrive and that our way of life prevails."

LineNo: 13298726,

Player_Romus: A complicated philosophical dilemm...
en


"A complicated philosophical dilemma, indeed."

LineNo: 13299384,

Player_Romus: Sorry, was that a rhetorical quest...
en


"Sorry, was that a rhetorical question?"

LineNo: 13299486,

Player_Romus: I seek to defend our kingdom, Sal....
en


"I seek to defend our kingdom, Sal. To ensure that the divine pillars flourish and that Wruhecism prevails."

LineNo: 13299588,

Player_Romus: I see no reason why it can't be bo...
en


"I see no reason why it can't be both."

LineNo: 13299690,

Player_Romus: Couldn't it be both?
en


"Couldn't it be both?"

LineNo: 13300070,

Sal Ignacius: Defending the pillars is noble, bu...
en


"Defending the pillars is noble, but we must tread carefully."

LineNo: 13300172,

Sal Ignacius: War should be the last resort, emp...
en


"War should be the last resort, employed only when all avenues for peace have been exhausted."

LineNo: 13300274,

Sal Ignacius: Our actions must align with the di...
en


"Our actions must align with the divine principles we hold dear."

LineNo: 13300392,

Player_Romus: We need to ensure that our motives...
en


"We need to ensure that our motives for the war are just and not rooted in personal benefits but rather the greater good."

LineNo: 13300494,

Player_Romus: Yet, positioning war as the ultimat...
en


Yet, positioning war as the ultimate recourse might lead to overlooked opportunities or even outright defeat."

LineNo: 13301152,

Player_Romus: So, what you're saying is, we shou...
en


"So, what you're saying is, we should exhaust all options until we're all too tired to fight? Great strategy."

LineNo: 13301254,

Player_Romus: Our intentions must be pure, then....
en


"Our intentions must be pure, then. We must ensure that our war serves not personal gain but the divine order."

LineNo: 13301356,

Player_Romus: I will not be constrained by the w...
en


"I will not be constrained by the whims of gods. If war is the path to power, then Wruhecism can be bent to serve it."

LineNo: 13301458,

Player_Romus: While I value the guidance of the...
en


"While I value the guidance of the divine, my responsibility lies with the well-being of my people. If war is the route to strength, I'll seek to align our faith with the path that ensures the prosperity of our realm."

LineNo: 13301844,

Sal Ignacius: Precisely, Your Majesty. War, if u...
en


"Precisely, Your Majesty. War, if unavoidable, should be waged with a heavy heart, a heart burdened by the weight of righteousness."

LineNo: 13301946,

Sal Ignacius: We must be vigilant, for the divin...
en


"We must be vigilant, for the divine does not condone unjust actions, even in the face of conflict."

LineNo: 13302072,

Player_Romus: I believe this war is justified. I...
en


"I believe this war is justified. If we don't act, we risk not only our principles but the safety and well-being of our people."

LineNo: 13302174,

Player_Romus: Then, I suppose I'll need to guara...
en


"Then, I suppose I'll need to guarantee that my next move in this conflict aligns with the principles of Wruhecism to ensure its justification, as provided by our sacred text."

LineNo: 13302832,

Player_Romus: Noted. I'll be sure to send a pray...
en


"Noted. I'll be sure to send a prayer for justice before my next strategic move."

LineNo: 13302934,

Player_Romus: I believe this war is justified. I...
en


"I believe this war is justified. If we don't act, we risk not only our principles but the safety and well-being of our people. In defending ourselves, we preserve the very values we hold dear."

LineNo: 13303036,

Player_Romus: Our actions are just if the Crown...
en


"Our actions are just if the Crown says they are. Religious dogma is a tool to be wielded, not the other way around."

LineNo: 13303138,

Player_Romus: With all due respect, religious do...
en


"With all due respect, religious dogma is a guiding tool, not a master."

LineNo: 13303518,

Sal Ignacius: May the divine guide our actions,...
en


"May the divine guide our actions, Your Majesty, and may our pursuit be just, in accordance with the sacred teachings."

LineNo: 13303898,

Sal Ignacius: There's nothing weak about adherin...
en


"There's nothing weak about adhering to one's religious values."

LineNo: 13304000,

Sal Ignacius: And it is most certainly not a shr...
en


"And it is most certainly not a shroud, It's a call to uphold the divine order."

LineNo: 13304102,

Sal Ignacius: War contradicts these principles,...
en


"War contradicts these principles, causing suffering and discord. Wruhecism stresses the importance of peace and the quest for harmony."

LineNo: 13304204,

Sal Ignacius: Wruhecism doesn't shackle ambition...
en


"Wruhecism doesn't shackle ambition; it guides it toward righteousness."

LineNo: 13304306,

Sal Ignacius: The pursuit of power at the cost o...
en


"The pursuit of power at the cost of others is not what the divine order advocates."

LineNo: 13304432,

Player_Romus: What if the divine order aligns wi...
en


"What if the divine order aligns with expansion, conquest?"

LineNo: 13304534,

Player_Romus: Yes, however, the path of governan...
en


"Yes, however, the path of governance may require decisions that, while distasteful, align with the greater divine purpose."

LineNo: 13304636,

Sal Ignacius: It firmly opposes any form of subj...
en


"It firmly opposes any form of subjugation."

LineNo: 13304738,

Sal Ignacius: The divine order calls for compass...
en


"The divine order calls for compassion, wisdom, and humility. War, especially unjust war, is not the path to righteousness."

LineNo: 13304856,

Player_Romus: Righteousness doesn't fill coffers...
en


"Righteousness doesn't fill coffers or expand borders. The divine order, if it exists, must understand the necessity of sacrifice for the greater good."

LineNo: 13304958,

Player_Romus: While I respect those virtues, the...
en


"While I respect those virtues, the path to righteousness might sometimes involve a sterner resolve, a divine duty to protect what is sacred."

LineNo: 13305060,

Sal Ignacius: While wealth and territory are ear...
en


"While wealth and territory are earthly pursuits, the divine order transcends material gains."

LineNo: 13305162,

Sal Ignacius: Sacrifice for the greater good sho...
en


"Sacrifice for the greater good should ensure that our pursuits are just and honorable."

LineNo: 13305264,

Sal Ignacius: War is not the path to true power....
en


"War is not the path to true power. It's a path to destruction, and a kingdom built on such foundations will crumble."

LineNo: 13305636,

Sal Ignacius: I fail to find any humor when it c...
en


"I fail to find any humor when it comes to war."

LineNo: 13305738,

Sal Ignacius: The principles of Wruhecism promot...
en


"The principles of Wruhecism promote peace, unity, and the pursuit of harmony."

LineNo: 13305840,

Player_Romus: Come now, Sal, surely there's a di...
en


"Come now, Sal, surely there's a divine loophole for a good, hearty war."

LineNo: 13305942,

Sal Ignacius: War conflicts with these principle...
en


"War conflicts with these principles, giving rise to both suffering and discord."

LineNo: 13306060,

Player_Romus: But does it really? It seems our h...
en


"But does it really? It seems our history is littered with war and violence."

LineNo: 13306162,

Player_Romus: War might be serious business, but...
en


"War might be serious business, but imagine if we could solve conflicts with sarcastic banter."

LineNo: 13306264,

Sal Ignacius: There are indeed instances in the...
en


"There are indeed instances in the sacred texts where war is justified, but it's not a divine loophole for merriment."

LineNo: 13306366,

Sal Ignacius: The circumstances must align with...
en


"The circumstances must align with celestial principles, a serious matter indeed."

LineNo: 13306484,

Player_Romus: To be perfectly honest, I fear tha...
en


"To be perfectly honest, I fear that keeping Rizia under one religious banner might lead to further divisions and unrest within our borders."

LineNo: 13306586,

Player_Romus: Wruhecisim, Dastnurism, Golcondism...
en


"Wruhecisim, Dastnurism, Golcondism... its all the same to me. It's maintaining order and preserving the monarchy that's most important."

LineNo: 13307244,

Player_Romus: Wruhecisim, Dastnurism, Golcondism...
en


"Wruhecisim, Dastnurism, Golcondism  it's like trying to distinguish between different shades of beige. I'm more concerned about maintaining order and ensuring the monarchy stays uncharacteristically bland."

LineNo: 13307346,

Player_Romus: I believe in the importance of uph...
en


"I believe in the importance of upholding the one truth faith. However, I fear it might lead to further divisions within our borders."

LineNo: 13307448,

Player_Romus: The unrest were seeing within our...
en


"The unrest were seeing within our borders must end. Period. And if religion, in any manifestation, can help us to achieve unity, I will wholeheartedly welcome it."

LineNo: 13307550,

Player_Romus: Its unity I seek above all else....
en


"Its unity I seek above all else. And if religion, in any manifestation, can achieve that, I will wholeheartedly welcome it."

LineNo: 13307930,

Sal Ignacius: Well, it goes without saying that...
en


"Well, it goes without saying that I'm partial to Rizia as a Wruhiescist state, but I will concede that there is more than one approach that could be considered."

LineNo: 13308048,

Sal Ignacius: Well, Your Majesty, if that's how...
en


"Well, Your Majesty, if that's how you see it, then I suppose the nuances of Wruhisim, Dastnurism, and Golcondism might indeed elude your discerning eye."

LineNo: 13308150,

Sal Ignacius: I'm unsure how to respond. Are spe...
en


"I'm unsure how to respond. Are speaking to me as your counselor on religion, or would you like to know what I really think?"

LineNo: 13308276,

Sal Ignacius: Well for one, to forge a powerful...
en


"Well for one, to forge a powerful and cohesive Rizian identity by remaining united under Wruhecism."

LineNo: 13308378,

Player_Romus: I aim to understand all available...
en


"I aim to understand all available choices thoroughly to ensure that my decision is well-informed."

LineNo: 13308480,

Player_Romus: I want you to speak as a man of fa...
en


"I want you to speak as a man of faith."

LineNo: 13308582,

Player_Romus: Oh, don't play coy. Just tell me w...
en


"Oh, don't play coy. Just tell me what you think."

LineNo: 13308684,

Player_Romus: I want your unbiased opinion, obvi...
en


"I want your unbiased opinion, obviously."

LineNo: 13308786,

Player_Romus: Those being?'
en


"Those being?'

LineNo: 13308888,

Sal Ignacius: That said, as your counselor on re...
en


"That said, as your counselor on religious affairs, I'm more than happy to share my unbiased thoughts."

LineNo: 13309014,

Player_Romus: Let's hear your biased thoughts.
en


"Let's hear your biased thoughts."

LineNo: 13309116,

Sal Ignacius: Alternatively, we could embrace a...
en


"Alternatively, we could embrace a pluralist faith-based state, recognizing the diverse spiritual threads that weave through our realm."

LineNo: 13309218,

Sal Ignacius: Lastly -- I can't believe I'm sayi...
en


"Lastly -- I can't believe I'm saying this -- you could separate religion from government entirely, taking a secular approach that would allow each citizen the freedom to navigate their faith independently."

LineNo: 13309320,

Player_Romus: What do you personally believe we...
en


"What do you personally believe we should do?"

LineNo: 13309422,

Sal Ignacius: Come now, Your Majesty, as a devou...
en


"Come now, Your Majesty, as a devout follower of Wruhecism, it's only natural that I'd stand firm for it in our kingdom."

LineNo: 13309524,

Player_Romus: What are the pros and cons of rema...
en


"What are the pros and cons of remaining a Wruhecistic state?"

LineNo: 13309626,

Sal Ignacius: All of which, bear in mind, come w...
en


"All of which, bear in mind, come with specific drawbacks and advantages."

LineNo: 13309878,

Player_Romus: Tell me what a governance that acc...
en


"Tell me what a governance that accommodates Nurity as a whole would look like."

LineNo: 13309980,

Player_Romus: As difficult as it may be, can you...
en


"As difficult as it may be, can you paint a picture of what a secular state might look like?"

LineNo: 13310082,

Sal Ignacius: Personal feelings aside, the key e...
en


"Personal feelings aside, the key element of taking a pluralistic approach lies in establishing a framework that respects diversity while maintaining a common ground for governance."

LineNo: 13310184,

Sal Ignacius: Unlike a singular religious influe...
en


"Unlike a singular religious influence, which might inadvertently exclude a portion of our population. And risk fostering resentment and alienation among those who don't adhere to the chosen faith."

LineNo: 13310310,

Player_Romus: True, but I can also see us gambli...
en


"True, but I can also see us gambling with the stability of our kingdom by attempting to please everyone."

LineNo: 13310412,

Player_Romus: Yes, however, I can also see how a...
en


"Yes, however, I can also see how a pluralistic approach might undermine a unified belief system and could lead to confusion and division among our people."

LineNo: 13310514,

Player_Romus: I could get behind that. Being inc...
en


"I could get behind that. Being inclusive and respecting diversity are crucial for the well-being of our kingdom. We must ensure that every citizen feels a part of our shared journey."

LineNo: 13310616,

Sal Ignacius: I share your concerns.
en


"I share your concerns."

LineNo: 13310718,
